Name: indexrelid
Description: The OID of the pg_class\n entry for this index

Name: indrelid
Description: The OID of the pg_class\n entry for the table this index is for

Name: indnatts
Description: The number of columns in the index (duplicates\n pg_class.relnatts)

Name: indisunique
Description: If true, this is a unique index

Name: indisprimary
Description: If true, this index represents the primary key of the\n table (indisunique should always be true when this is true)

Name: indisexclusion
Description: If true, this index supports an exclusion\n constraint

Name: indimmediate
Description: If true, the uniqueness check is enforced immediately\n on insertion (irrelevant if indisunique is not true)

Name: indisclustered
Description: If true, the table was last clustered on this\n index

Name: indisvalid
Description: If both this flag and indisready are true, the index is\n currently valid for queries. False means the index is possibly incomplete: it must still be modified by INSERT/UPDATE operations, but it cannot safely be used for queries. If it is unique, the uniqueness property is not guaranteed true either.

Name: indcheckxmin
Description: If true, queries must not use the index until the\n xmin of this pg_index row is below their TransactionXmin event horizon, because the table may contain broken HOT chains with incompatible rows that they can see

Name: indisready
Description: If true, the index is currently ready for inserts.\n False means the index must be ignored by INSERT/UPDATE operations.

Name: indkey
Description: This is an array of indnatts values that indicate which\n table columns this index indexes. For example a value of 1 3 would mean that the first and the third table columns make up the index key. A zero in this array indicates that the corresponding index attribute is an expression over the table columns, rather than a simple column reference.

Name: indcollation
Description: For each column in the index key, this contains the\n OID of the collation to use for the index.

Name: indclass
Description: For each column in the index key, this contains the\n OID of the operator class to use. See pg_opclass for details.

Name: indoption
Description: This is an array of indnatts values that store per-column\n flag bits. The meaning of the bits is defined by the index's access method.

Name: indexprs
Description: Expression trees (in nodeToString() representation) for\n index attributes that are not simple column references. This is a list with one element for each zero entry in indkey. Null if all index attributes are simple references.

Name: indpred
Description: Expression tree (in nodeToString() representation) for\n partial index predicate. Null if not a partial index.
